Judul: EMPLOYEE PERCEPTION ON BUSINESS ETHICS AS RESPONSE TO CODE OF CONDUCT AND MEMR REGULATION NO.22/2008 ON COST RECOVERY NEGATIVE LIST
Abstrak:
This evaluation is made to test the employee perception on business ethics as response to code of conduct and Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (MEMR) No.22/2008 on cost recovery negative list. The approach was chosen because the Code of Conduct and MEMR No.22/2008 are the applied regulations that limit and, expected, to foster an ethical culture that attached to the company.  
 

Or at least both could serve as daily business buoys that could increase the business ethics awareness,  
 

which in turn could be expected to increase the company's performance in the long run by conducting  
 

a more ethical business.  
 

The evaluation is limited by only studying the employee population of ABC, an upstream oil and gas company, acquired from daily business interaction and field experience and exposure. The employee perception then formulated in qualitative methods for the sole academic purpose of this thesis. Another limitation is the ceteris paribus assumption that every employee has an adequate awareness either on the Code of Conduct or the MEMR No.22/2008.  
 

The evaluation found out that the employee perception on business ethics was unaffected after being exposed to the Code of Conduct and MEMR No.22/2008, but instead there were increased appropriate awareness that hopefully could affect the corporate performance increment
